page.title: 05The Peak Forest Tramway
page.content:
The Peak Forest Tramway is nothing but a shadow of what it used to be. All that is left of what used to be a major part of the industry of the High Peak is a few stone sleepers and some bits and pieces of metal. Don't let me mislead you by saying the Tramway is unused - for some people it is the favourite spot for taking their dog for a walk or a perfect place for a stroll. Sometimes the Cub-Scouts use the tramway and make a trail on it for the younger cubs to follow. The Tramway line started at the limestone quarries at Dove Holes and was built to carry limestone to the terminus of the Peak Forest Canal at Buxworth Basin, for trans-shipment into the narrowboats.
by{Christopher Hallam
